meanings.definition: Not able to be shaken or disturbed.
meanings.sent1: The mountain stood unshakable against the strong winds.
meanings.sent2: Her belief in herself was unshakable, no matter what others said.
meanings.sent3: The unshakable tree refused to sway even when the storm tried to push it over.
meanings.sent4: His unshakable determination carried him through the toughest challenges.
meanings.sent5: The unshakable bond between the siblings kept them close despite any disagreements.

meanings.sent1: The unshakable foundation of the building ensured its stability.
meanings.sent2: The rules of the game were unshakable and had to be followed.
meanings.sent3: The unshakable chair refused to budge no matter how hard he pushed it.
meanings.sent4: Their unshakable friendship had lasted since childhood.
meanings.sent5: The unshakable tradition was passed down through generations.

meanings.sent1: Her unshakable loyalty to her friends never wavered.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's unshakable courage inspired his comrades.
meanings.sent3: The unshakable clock kept ticking even after falling off the table.
meanings.sent4: His unshakable faith in himself led to great achievements.
meanings.sent5: The unshakable resolve of the team led them to victory.
